discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ACD
I think correct answer is ACD

Selected Answer: ACD
Only roaming profiles are able to save user settings.
With mandatory profiles, user changes are not saved.

ACD - Writable Volume – As well as the packages of applications, you can also deliver writable volumes, which are empty VMDK or VHD files that contain personalized data such as the user profile, licensing, configuration, user-installed applications, and other settings. You can assign a writable volume to a specific user, which is then available to that user from any device upon login.

Selected Answer: ADE
The answer should ADE

questions.question_text:
An administrator has been tasked with determining the type of Horizon deployment for their organization.
These requirements have been provided to the administrator:
✑ It must support Windows 7 and Windows 10 desktops.
✑ It must support App Volumes Cloud.
✑ It must support hybrid cloud.
✑ It must support Centralize brokering.
✑ It must automatically route end users to the most appropriate virtual workspace.
Which deployment solution meets the requirements?

discussion.content:
Workspace ONE does not support Windows7 - answer C is incorrect
On-Premise is not an option because Win7 is not supported on Horizon 8
vSphere Desktop Edition is no longer available
So Answers B has to be correct.

Selected Answer: B
https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/76934
B only 1 that supports win7

B
https://blogs.vmware.com/euc/2019/09/windows-virtual-desktop-horizon-azure.html

A
https://blogs.vmware.com/networkvirtualization/2019/04/guest-introspection-re-introduction-for-nsx-t-2-4.html/

Selected Answer: A
NSX is an optional component of the VMware Tools which are already installed on any virtual desktop, so there is no other agent needed = I would call this "agentless", matching the question..so answer A: VMware NSX-T with Guest Introspection

As per chat GPT:
No, VMware NSX-T with guest introspection requires an agent to be installed on each guest operating system to provide advanced threat prevention and detection capabilities. The Guest Introspection service is a lightweight virtual machine that is installed on each guest operating system and acts as a bridge between the virtual network and antivirus/security software running on the host system. This enables the virtual network to detect and prevent malicious traffic without having to install any additional software onto the virtual machines themselves.
It's A

comments.content: But we are talking about anti-malware so A

The Guest Introspection platform has been included in NSX Data Center for vSphere for several years, mostly as a replacement for the VMware vShield Endpoint product and providing customers the ability to plug in their VMware certified partner solutions to allow agent-less anti-virus and anti-malware protections for a variety of data center workloads.

as in https://blogs.vmware.com/networkvirtualization/2019/04/guest-introspection-re-introduction-for-nsx-t-2-4.html/

 Improve consolidation ratios and performance
by eliminating antivirus agents from guest
virtual machines.

A. VMware NSX-T with Guest Introspection
Vshield need agent
https://www.virtualizationworks.com/datasheets/VMware-vShield5-Endpoint-Datasheet.pdf
vShield Endpoint plugs directly into vSphere and consists of
three components:
• Hardened secure virtual appliances, delivered by VMware partners
• Thin agent for virtual machines to offload security events
(included in VMware Tools)
